{{POV-title|date=August 2011}}<!--unsourced title, and Hama is been "under siege"/attack for longer than 24 hours. It started at least on July 8, of even July 3 depending on the source used. -->
The '''Siege of Hama''' occurred on 31 July, 2011, primarily in the [[Syrian]] city of [[Hama]]. The [[government of Syria]] sent the [[Syrian army]] to Hama to control protests. Live ammunition was indiscriminately fired on the civilian population, along with tank and artillery fire.<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/07/201173143432348733.html 'Scores dead' as Syrian tanks storm Hama city - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> At least 142 people have died, with over 100 in Hama alone, and 19 in [[Deir ez-Zor]]. Hundreds more have been wounded. The crackdown has been the most intense of the [[2011 Syrian uprising]] so far, with already over 2200 protesters deaths since March 15.<ref>[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/43295395/ns/world_news-mideast_n_africa/t/syria-says-forces-killed-northern-massacre/ Syria says 120 forces killed in 'massacre' - World news - Mideast/N. Africa - msnbc.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.dawn.com/2011/07/31/syrian-army-kills-at-least-95-in-hama-activist.html Syrian army kills at least 95 in Hama: activist | World | DAWN.COM<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
The '''Siege of Hama''' occurred on 31 July, 2011, primarily in the [[Syrian]] city of [[Hama]]. The [[government of Syria]] sent the [[Syrian army]] to Hama to control protests. Live ammunition was indiscriminately fired on the civilian population, along with tank and artillery fire.<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/07/201173143432348733.html 'Scores dead' as Syrian tanks storm Hama city - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> At least 142 people have died, with over 100 in Hama alone, and 19 in [[Deir ez-Zor]]. Hundreds more have been wounded. The crackdown has been the most intense of the [[2011 Syrian uprising]] so far, with already over 2200 protesters deaths since March 15.<ref>[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/43295395/ns/world_news-mideast_n_africa/t/syria-says-forces-killed-northern-massacre/ Syria says 120 forces killed in 'massacre' - World news - Mideast/N.
